map_markers.name: Houston
map_markers.description:
Score: 89/100 — Healthy
────────────
Weather: 24°C, Partly cloudy (score: 98)
Status: Houston's container throughput is at 98% capacity, driven by
resin exports and petrochemical imports. Gate turn times are
averaging 75 minutes due to chassis shortages. Gulf Coast
weather patterns are causing intermittent vessel delays.

map_markers.name: New York
map_markers.description:
Score: 71/100 — Moderate Risk
────────────
Weather: -3°C, Clear sky (score: 68)
Status: New York and New Jersey terminals are experiencing a surge
in import volumes from Europe, up 15% compared to last
month. Port Authority is implementing new gate appointment
systems to reduce truck congestion. Labor negotiations are
ongoing, creating some uncertainty.

map_markers.name: Los Angeles
map_markers.description:
Score: 87/100 — Healthy
────────────
Weather: 22°C, Overcast (score: 95)
Status: The Port of Los Angeles is operating at 85% capacity, with
average container dwell times at 4.5 days. Increased empty
container returns are creating yard congestion.
Trans-Pacific trade volumes remain strong, but are showing
signs of softening.

map_markers.name: Savannah
map_markers.description:
Score: 87/100 — Healthy
────────────

investments. Strong demand for warehousing space in the

geopolitical.description: Analyzed recent supply chain news. Found 2 high-severity and 1 medium-severity risk events affecting the score.
geopolitical.calculation: Score = 85 - (Total VADER Negativity). We start at 85 (perfect stability is rare). Each negative news article deducts points based on its severity (High = -8, Medium = -4). Historical trend is modeled using the VIX Volatility Index.

tariffs.description: Economic Policy Uncertainty Index is at 508.2. Higher uncertainty often correlates with tariff volatility and trade barriers.
tariffs.calculation: Score = 100 - (Normalized Uncertainty). We track the Economic Policy Uncertainty Index. We normalize the current value against its 5-year range. Higher uncertainty = Lower Supply Chain Health Score.

energy.description: Crude oil is trading at $64.42/barrel. Real-time pricing from futures markets.
energy.calculation: Score = 100 - (Normalized Price). We baseline the LIVE price against the 5-year historical range. Current price is positioned within the 5-year min-max range, then inverted (Higher Price = Lower Score).

demand.description: Copper is trading at $5.96/lb with 44.3% annualized volatility. Elevated copper prices indicate strong global industrial demand relative to available supply, increasing upstream input costs.
demand.calculation: Score = 100 - (PriceFactor 0.45 × 60) - (VolFactor 0.81 × 40). Reflects demand-side pressure; does not account for speculative pricing or short-term supply disruptions.

shipping.description: Real-time shipping health derived from bunker fuel costs (Crude Oil $64.42) and market volatility (VIX 17.4).
